results.title: ‘Elvis’ Review: Shocking the King Back to Life
results.abstract: Austin Butler plays the singer, with Tom Hanks as his devilish manager, in Baz Luhrmann’s operatic, chaotic anti-biopic.

multimedia.caption: Austin Butler as Elvis Presley in “Elvis,” directed by Baz Luhrmann. The soundtrack shakes up the expected playlist, and offers the strongest argument for Presley’s relevance.
Austin Butler as Elvis Presley in “Elvis,” directed by Baz Luhrmann. The soundtrack shakes up the expected playlist, and offers the strongest argument for Presley’s relevance.

results.title: ‘Marcel the Shell With Shoes On’ Review: Bigger Isn’t Better
results.abstract: The one-inch-high shell voiced by Jenny Slate gets a feature-length vehicle, but the transition from YouTube fame is only partly successful.
des_facet: Marcel the Shell With Shoes On (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Marcel, the star of “Marcel the Shell With Shoes On,” has a googly eye, a pair of shoes and a high-pitched, babyish voice (Jenny Slate).

results.title: ‘Vedette’ Review: A Cow’s Trouble in Paradise
results.abstract: In this documentary, two French filmmakers meet a formidable Swiss cow and, under her impassive gaze, ruminate on her Alpine life.

results.title: A Quiet Word With Italy’s Master of Horror
results.abstract: A 20-film retrospective in New York of the filmmaker Dario Argento’s work shows why he’s had audiences jumping out of their seats for nearly five decades.

results.title: For the Most Complex Heroines in Animation, Look to Japan
results.abstract: The girls and women of anime tend to experience the conflicting emotions of real life. That’s because the auteurs try to create “an everyday, real person.”

multimedia.caption: In “Belle,” a teenager expresses grief, pain and anger even as her alter ego is the reigning pop star of the cyberworld.

results.title: Anatomy of a Product Placement
results.abstract: As consumers skip ads and streaming content balloons, brands aim to be everywhere all at once.

results.title: Still Charming at 50: Luis Buñuel’s Greatest Hit
results.abstract: “The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeois” is a comedy of frustrations in which a sextet of super-civilized haute bourgeois repeatedly attempt and fail to sit down at dinner.

results.abstract: The animated fan favorite, released 20 years ago this week, featured nuanced depictions of Hawaii and strong female characters.

results.title: Paul Haggis Arrested on Sexual Assault Charges in Italy
results.abstract: Haggis, who wrote and directed the Oscar-winning crime drama “Crash,” was accused of assaulting a woman in Ostuni over the course of two days.
results.byline: By Emma Bubola and Sarah Bahr

multimedia.caption: Paul Haggis, who was arrested on charges of aggravated sexual violence and aggravated personal injuries in Southern Italy. “He is totally innocent,” his lawyer Priya Chaudhry said.

results.title: Jean-Louis Trintignant, Star of Celebrated European Films, Dies at 91
results.abstract: For 50 years, in movies like “A Man and a Woman” and “My Night at Maud’s,” his specialty was playing the flawed Everyman.

multimedia.caption: Jean-Louis Trintignant in the 1960s. In contrast to French film stars like the wisecracking Jean-Paul Belmondo, the working-class hero Jean Gabin and the suave sophisticate Maurice Chevalier, Mr. Trintignant was known for performances that were understated.

Jean-Louis Trintignant in the 1960s. In contrast to French film stars like the wisecracking Jean-Paul Belmondo, the working-class hero Jean Gabin and the suave sophisticate Maurice Chevalier, Mr. Trintignant was known for performances that were understated.
